title: L1 Stake ERC20 Decimal Place Gas Miscalculation
body:
**Describe the bug**

The gas price has 18 decimal places appended to the Gwei cost when depositing DAI, this results in a very high gas price, but also notable that the UI shows no indication the deposit failed due to insufficient funds.

##### notable: I tried USDC and was able to stake without such issues so it's not affecting all ERC20

**To Reproduce**

- Network: Rinkeby L1
- Page: Earn
    * DAI Deposit
        * 300 DAI in possession
        * .049 ETH in possession
        * 250 DAI deposit attempt

- Failed to add Liquidity error message produced in UI

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/66543372/132995196-faee3e6d-6f9c-40d7-bfbf-f1403df10a3b.png)

    want 250 000 000 000 000 000 000 (supplied gas 15010499) 
Object { code: -32000, message: "err: insufficient funds for gas * price + value: address 0x3529B4E50AbbED0a82371d26049d471280540464 have 49066321516461071 want 250000000000000000000 (supplied gas 15010499)" }

**Expected behavior**
Produce a gas price of 250 000 000 000 000, in other words, with 6 fewer 0's appended and if insufficient funds lead to a failed transaction, that the info be relayed over the UI.
Is this a bug with https://gateway.boba.network? If so, please report to https://github.com/omgnetwork/optimism/issues (Boba is a fork of this repo with its own Gateway).

Yes, sorry that I forgot to mention that in the issue. I tested it on
Rinkeby's L1 of gateway.boba.network, if you'd like any other details I'll
know to watch for inquiries here.

p.s. I'm sure it's obvious, but title title and math were both wrong in the
issue I opened, I think, but I did test this with USDC with no ability to
reproduce the issue. I believe it was introduced around the time that
decimal places for the ERC20 tokens were being distinguished from a purely
18 digit expectation, no evidence of that though.
